questions.question: 1. In a gene interaction graph, a directed edge from Gene A to Gene B implies:

answers.a: Gene A and Gene B are co-expressed
answers.c: Gene A inhibits Gene B permanently
answers.d: Gene A has no impact on Gene B

questions.question: 2. The significance of edge weights in gene interaction networks is:

answers.a: They indicate the relative strength of gene interactions
answers.b: They show the genetic similarity between species
answers.c: They help identify the total number of genes in a genome
answers.d: They measure the molecular size of genes

questions.question: 3. An application of Dijkstraâ€™s Algorithm in biological systems is:

answers.b: Finding the most efficient regulatory pathways in gene networks
answers.d: Estimating the mutation rate in DNA

questions.question: 4. A network topology important in artificial neural networks because:

answers.a: It defines the arrangement of neurons and connections
answers.b: It controls the speed of data processing
answers.c: It determines the amount of data a network can store
answers.d: It acts as a firewall for protecting data

questions.question: 5. Which aspect of gene interaction networks can be modelled using graphs ?
